trial_identification.studytitle: Speech recognition in right and left handers normal hearing: there is a difference?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Speech recognition in noise in right and left handers normal hearing: there is a difference?

interventions.interventions: The Portuguese Sentences Lists test to right and left handers was applied. With this test was obtained the speech recognition thresholds in noise and the signal to noise ratio to each ear. The application was made in a single session of 20 minutes and was applied only once in each participant. The total study duration was 4 months.
interventions.comparator: Speech recognition thresholds for normal hearing - Uncontrolled.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The Portuguese Sentences Lists test to right and left handers was applied. With this test was obtained the speech recognition thresholds in noise and the signal to noise ratio to each ear.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Signal to noise ratio. From the average of the Speech recognition thresholds in noise was subtracted the noise intensity (fixed to 65 dBNA), obtaining the signal to noise ratio for each ear.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Hearing thresholds under 25 dB from 500 to 4000 Hz; no complaints of tinnitus and hyperacusis.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Hearing loss; complaints of tinnitus and hyperacusis.

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
Assess the speech recognition in right and left handed adults subjects with normal hearing and observe the differences between the groups.
It is known that there brain differences, structural or functional, between right- and left handers, reflected in speech recognition.
